summary: The “Protecting Americans from Doxing and Political Violence Act” aims to protect Members of Congress, their families, and staff from doxing—the public disclosure of their personal information that could lead to harm. The bill defines “covered information” (home addresses, phone numbers, etc.) and outlines restrictions on government agencies, data brokers, and websites regarding the sharing and public display of this information. It allows at-risk individuals to request the removal of their information, establishes exceptions for news reporting and voluntary disclosures, and provides for legal recourse. The bill aims to improve the safety and security of at-risk individuals through the use of technology regulation, and privacy safeguards.
